p: Table 3 shows the mean sleep scores of the study participants from the Pittsburgh Sleep Quality Index (PSQI) questionnaire. The results showed that in the two weeks of the study, sleeping disorders were significantly increased in people aged 18–24 years (-0.433). However, behaviors were significantly improved in people aged between 25–39 years (0.629), and the emotional and behavioral condition were improved in people aged 40–59 years (0.904 and 0.622).
